author: potuz
content: No, I want to alleviate the exit queue churn and the wait for partial withrawals by allowing delegating your validator excess earnings to other (possibly new) validators. This way pools can immediately compound and will make for a much better UX. A wip can be found in  <https://github.com/potuz/consensus-specs/blob/crux/specs/crux/beacon-chain.md>

author: jgm
content:
I'd start with a rationale, rather than implementation details.  For example, if a large exit queue is a concern then it would be great to lay out the details of how much it would cost a validator to exit and balance that against frequency of proposal to see under which conditions a rational validator is likely to exit.

I'd still be concerned about the fact that this requires existing validators to create a new validator, which requires at least 1 Ether from the execution layer to start with, and so would possibly increase centralization.  On-chain cost (transmission and storage) of potentially lots of `delegate` operations would be another area.  Would be good to see these discussed.

author: potuz
content: I am writing the rationale document to go with the PR. It'll be ready when I open it. I'm not requiring 1 eth nor any interaction with EL. This is already in the implementation above
